alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 11 at 5:10AM PST until December 12 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Riverside County Mountains and San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Minor mud and debris flows possible in and below recent burn scars, including the Apple and El Dorado burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of moderate to heavy rainfall is expected to move through the mountains today. Strong south to southwest flow ahead of the cold front will aid in orographic precipitation along the coastal slopes of the mountains. Hourly rain rates of one-half inch or more are possible with this storm. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
